docTitle.titlePart:
DAMAGE FROM INFESTING MAIZE PLANTS WITH EUROPEAN
CORN BORER' EGG MASSES AND LARVAE'

byline.docAuthor: W. D. Guthrie, J. L. Jarvis, and J. C. Robbins

byline.affiliation: Department of Entomology, Iowa State University,

front.div:
Abstract: During 8 4-yr period (1979-1982), 10 to 25 genotypes of maize, Zea mays L., were
infested with two, three, or four applications of European corn borer (ECB), Ostn"nia nubilalis
(Hubner), egg masses or larvae (ca 50 eggs or 50 larvae/plant/application). One yr out of
four, leaf feeding damage by fll'St-generation ECBs and sheath-collar feeding damage by
second-generation ECBs were significantly greater from infestations with larvae than with
